fields.name: Dark Guatemalan Coffee
fields.description: Guatemalan coffee is revered as one of the most flavorful and nuanced cups in the world. Due to our proximity to Guatemala, some of the finest coffees from this origin come to the United States. Coffee beans are roasted immediately before packaging. Coffee is roasted in our environmentally friendly coffee roaster to protect the environment.
fields.description_2: The unparalleled flavor of Fresh Roasted Coffee's exclusive blends and single-origin coffees can be attributed to our state of the art roasting technology. Using our Smart Roaster we are able to turn exotic raw coffee from around the world into precisely roasted beans time after time. We are specifically able to alter the flavor profiles of the coffee to ensure unmatched quality and freshness. Our Smart Roaster requires no afterburner allowing for dramatically less environmental impact than traditional roasters. Our roaster reduces greenhouse gas emissions by up to 80% making it the most ecologically friendly roasting technology on the market. Here at Fresh Roasted Coffee LLC, with the help of our revolutionary roaster, we are consistently able to produce clean, pure and undeniably fresh tasting cups of coffee with little to no environmental repercussions.

fields.name: Reborn Coffee Cobán Chichen
fields.description: Fair Trade Certified Coffees. Process: Reborn washed. Fresh Roasted Coffee. Net Weight: 12 oz. Bag. Altitude: 1350-1500 meters. Roasting Profile: Medium roast. Roasted Fresh Daily & Shipped Directly. Cupping Notes: Mild acidity, Full Body, Dark Chocolate, Lavender, Caramelized Sugar, Long Aftertaste

fields.name: Ampersand Coffee Roasters - Guatemala Nahuala
fields.description: Product of Cafe Femenino Guatemala. 1/2 percent of Ampersand's revenue is donated to the International Women's Coffee Alliance.
fields.description_2: Cupping Profile: Dark chocolate with a ripe grape lining. This coffee has a mild round acidity, a pleasant sweet-chocolate aftertaste, and a full body. These attributes are simple and complimentary. Crowd pleaser. Medium Roast.

fields.name: Gevalia Special Reserve Guatemala
fields.description: Gevalia Guatemala Single Origin Special Reserve Coarse Ground Coffee, crafted in the Swedish tradition, fills your mug with rich and never-bitter coffee. There are 150 years of Swedish craftsmanship brewed into this rich, medium bodied brew. This medium roast coffee offers depth and complexity of earthy, smoky notes and a hint of cocoa. Sourced exclusively from Guatemala, a country known for its majestic mountain ranges, the high altitude strongly influences this coffee's deliciously unique flavor. This coffee contains 100% Arabica beans from farms that have achieved Rainforest Alliance certification, which encourages a minimum of 40% shade cover on farms located in naturally forested areas.
fields.description_2: Make the perfect cup in any drip brewer or try using this coarse grind in your French press, pour-over brewer or moka pot. After opening, lock in flavor with the fold over tin tie resealable bag. Try Gevalia ground coffee and experience the taste of 150 years of Swedish tradition. With over 30 premium coffees, from intense dark roasts to exotic varietals, you are sure to find your perfect sip.
fields.cupping_notes: Deep, earthy, smoky notes with hints of cocoa.

fields.name: Peet's Coffee
fields.description: Nestled between three massive volcanoes at an elevation of 5,000 feet, the Antigua Valley of Guatemala produces arguably the world's finest coffee. Only here does the heirloom variety of Arabica bean known as Borbón develop such a sublimely sweet coffee fruit, with the dry climate stressing trees just enough to give the beans their tantalizingly complex flavors. Among coffee appellations, Antigua is perhaps the best of the best. One estate in this renowned region stands out above all others, both for its quality and care: Finca San Sebastián. Early sun, upper slopes, an abundance of shaded Borbón—everything about this farm is perfect for producing coffee of consistently superlative quality. Environmental stewardship and community support is integral to Finca San Sebastián’s operations. In addition to implementing practices that care for the land and workers, the farm houses and funds a local school that educates more than 100 children each year; we contribute to this work with every pound we purchase.
fields.description_2: We buy beans from many of the great Antigua farms, and they shine in our most superb blends, but our single-origin offering could only be San Sebastián. It achieves the remarkable feat of tasting both potent and refined, with aromatic grace and shades of the best bittersweet chocolate, all while supporting people and the environment.

fields.name: La Hermosa Natural - Guatemala
fields.description: La Hermosa’s fruit wine sweetness and indulgent chocolate notes are impossible to resist.  Harvesting from only world-famous Pacamara coffee plants, the producer spends up to a month drying these ripe coffee cherries to ensure their fruit flavors are fully expressed.
fields.description_2: The greatest coffee in the world is grown in volcanic soil and Guatemala is the land of volcanoes.  Max Perez grows his coffee at Finca La Hermosa between two active volcanoes and takes painstaking care to reap all the benefits of that perfect environment. The rich earth and clear sky of that sun-drenched farm are reflected in the intensity and depth of this juicy and satisfying offering.

fields.name: Two Volcanoes Coffee
fields.description: This single origin specialty brings out the best possible aroma and flavor every morning. No blending in from other regions, countries or types of coffee, gives this rare but delicious tasting coffee, a flavor compared to no other. This specific single estate coffee is grown at the base of Two Volcanoes in Guatemala. Great for House or high end restaurants. Better tasting than french roast coffee.
fields.description_2: Small batch roasting is more expensive because of labor costs, but ensures that each bean of coffe is of superior quality and roasted evenly to desired specifications. This process draws out the best possible flavor in each batch. Small batch roasting permits a higher quality standard in coffee throughout the complete process: from picking out the correct size of each coffee bean, to slowly roasting each small batch to perfection.

fields.name: Grand Paradé Coffee
fields.description: This gem of a coffee farmed on volcano slopes surrounding Lake Atitlan in Guatemala is refreshing and complex with concord grape and red currant notes. A soft apple-like acidity and hints of berries hug a lovely chocolate body with a toffee butteriness. Dried dates, vanilla, and cocoa powder create a dynamic base for a very approachable cup of coffee.
fields.description_2: Coffees from Atitlán in Guatemala are among the more sought-after in all of Central America. Surrounded by three towering volcanoes, the lake and surrounding hills provide perfect coffee-growing conditions. Our organic Guatemalan coffee is farmed by the 160 small-holder farmers of the organic certified La Voz co-op in Atitlán. Of the five volcanic coffee regions of Guatemala, Atitlán’s soil is the richest in organic matter. 90% of Atitlán coffee is cultivated along the slopes of the dramatic volcanoes that dominate the shores of Lake Atitlán. The Lake is considered one of the most beautiful lakes in the world and is a Guatemalan national treasure. It’s massive depth and cold waters trigger microclimates that regulate temperature extremes in this unique and beautiful place. Daily winds (called Xocomil) stir the cold lake waters, influencing variations in the micro-climates of the region.

fields.name: SEVEN Coffee Roasters - Guatemala Trapichitos
fields.description: Made from passive organic, hand-picked and sun dried coffee beans. Our Guatemala Specialty is a medium roast with all the flavor.
fields.description_2: Our Guatemala specialty coffee beans are passive organic, hand-picked, and sun-dried on raised wooden racks.  The bourbon-like beans are meticulously processed and sorted at a community co-op in the Trapichitos region of Guatemala. The resulting cup is beautifully nuanced, with a delicate smoky tone. You’ll get flavors of hazelnut, apple, and cedar in this medium-light bodied coffee.

fields.name: Peace Coffee Organic Guatemala
fields.description: Rich and Chocolaty Dark Roast. Whole Bean Coffee. Organic and Fair Trade. Certified B Corporation. Fresh Roasted in Minneapolis, MN. 12 oz bag. Peace Coffee began in 1996 with a mission to make exceptional tasting, organic and fair trade coffee. As a B Corporation located in the heart of Minneapolis, Peace Coffee is dedicated to paying small-scale farmers industry-leading prices and offering staff competitive wages with supportive benefits.
fields.description_2: Peace Coffee's dark roast Guatemala is grown by the Apecaform cooperative, a trading relationship that spans 20 years. An amazingly sweet and rich coffee, each cup is a loving tribute to the small group of growers who work so hard to produce it.
